name: For 'Blues Brothers' Diehards, Part 2 Quiz | Movies | 15 Questions

questions.text: When Elwood Blues (Dan Aykroyd) is first pulled over by the police, he tells his brother Jake (John Belushi) that the cops probably have 'SCMODS,' an acronym for a particular type of computerized database. What does the 'C' in 'SCMODS' stand for?
questions.explanation:
County.

	Elwood: 'They probably got SCMODS.' Jake: 'SCMODS?' Elwood: 'State County Municipal Offender Data System.'

questions.text: The Blues brothers lead a number of police cars through a merry chase in a shopping mall. Which of the following establishments does the Bluesmobile NOT damage during this chase?
questions.explanation:
Pier 1 Imports.

	The boys plow through a number of storefronts, but Pier 1 Imports is not one of them: Elwood points out the store to Jake in passing, but they never do any damage to it.

questions.text: The first time Camille (Carrie Fisher) tries to kill Jake, what song is playing in the background?
questions.explanation:
'Theme From Peter Gunn'.

	The 'Peter Gunn' theme plays as Camille fires a rocket at Jake and Elwood.  She misses them, but destroys the facade of the hotel where Elwood stays.

questions.text: An old man who lives in Elwood's hotel apparently made an earlier off-screen request for Elwood to bring him a certain type of food product. What was it?
questions.explanation:
Cheez Whiz.

	He asks, 'You get me my Cheez Whiz, boy?' Elwood wordlessly produces a can of Cheez Whiz from his jacket and tosses it to the old man. Weird.

questions.text: When Elwood informs Lloyd (the hotel manager, it would seem) that Jake will be staying with him for a couple of weeks, Lloyd is rather distracted by a sporting event that he's watching on a small television. What sport is Lloyd watching?
questions.explanation:
wrestling.

	It's too small an image for me to tell which fighters he's watching. Anyone know?

questions.text: Elwood isn't especially worried about being tracked down by the police, as he used a fake address when he renewed his driver's license. What Chicago landmark's address did he use?
options: the Field Museum of Natural History
questions.explanation:
Wrigley Field.

	Jake: '1060 West Addison? That's Wrigley Field.' Elwood's little trick works on both the state police and the 'Illinois Nazis.'

questions.text: Which of the following weapons does Camille NOT use against Jake (and Elwood) during the film?
questions.explanation:
a hand grenade.

	Camille uses a flame-thrower to ignite a propane tank right next to the phone booth Jake and Elwood are using; she destroys Elwood's hotel with a bomb she remote-detonates from her car; and in her final attack, she fires bursts from an assault rifle at the boys in the storm drain. We never see her using a hand grenade in the film.

questions.text: After Jake comes up with the idea to reunite the band, which band member or members do the boys try to find first?
questions.explanation:
Tommy 'Bones' Malone and 'Blue' Lou Marini.

	The first stop the boys make is the former residence of Tommy 'Bones' Malone and 'Blue' Lou Marini.

questions.text: At one point, Jake and Elwood question a woman who was once the landlady of one or more members of the old Blues Brothers Band. What is her name?
questions.explanation:
Mrs. Tarentino

	No relation, one would think, to filmmaker Quentin, given the different spelling. =)

questions.text: When Murph and the Magic Tones are first seen, they are playing a song with Spanish lyrics. What's the song?
questions.explanation:
'Cuando, Cuando, Cuando'.

	Gotta love that Holiday Inn lounge music.

questions.text: It's revealed during a conversation with the Magic Tones that Jake went to prison for armed robbery. In his defense, though, he only performed that crime to make up for money lost when the Blues Brothers Band played a 'Kiwanis gig.' In what city did this infamous gig take place?
questions.explanation:
Coal City & Cole City.

	Ah, the things we do for friends.

questions.text: Finish the name of the restaurant where Mr. Fabulous (Alan Rubin) works as a Maitre D: Chez _______.
questions.explanation:
Paul & Paule.

	Chez Paul was an actual French restaurant on Chicago's Rush Street, but it closed some time ago.

questions.text: On which street in Chicago would one find the restaurant where Matt 'Guitar' Murphy works?
questions.explanation:
Maxwell Street.

	This fact is mentioned by one of the Magic Tones. Maxwell Street restaurants are well-known for their distinctive takes on both Polish sausage and pork chop sandwiches -- so well-known, in fact, that dining establishments nowhere near that location offer 'Maxwell Street style' sandwiches by name.

questions.text: Mr. Fabulous is taking a phone reservation when Jake and Elwood first show up at his restaurant. What is the last name of the person making the reservation?
questions.explanation:
Rizzolo.

	Specifically, we hear Mr. Fabulous say, 'Rizzolo, for 8, at 11:30.' Landis is the director's name; Virgil 'The Turk' Solozzo was a character in 'The Godfather'; and Abe Froman was 'the sausage king of Chicago' who was mentioned and impersonated (but never actually seen) in 1986's 'Ferris Bueller's Day Off.'

questions.text: Jake and Elwood barge their way into Mr. Fabulous' restaurant and plop themselves down at a table. The actor who plays their wine steward is better known for playing which of the following characters?
questions.correct: Pee Wee Herman in 'Pee Wee's Big Adventure'
options: Father Guido Sarducci on 'Saturday Night Live'
questions.explanation:
Pee Wee Herman in 'Pee Wee's Big Adventure'.

	Yes, that's Paul Reubens playing Jake and Elwood's waiter. More 'Blues Brothers' quizzes to come, so stay tuned!
